reviewText:
This game is pretty badass but you may have to use one of the community fixes or patches to get it working on your pc. I have owned this game several times and can reccomend it at reduced price/sale. I bought this one steam for a few bucks a while ago, so I say wait for a nice sale.
Looking through the negative reviews, I can see that most of them are from inept kids. How they even manage to use the PC at all is wonder itself.
This is an old title and may need some love and a little bit of a pass on the graphics/animations.

One of my favorite things about this is the many persuade type dialogues. You can intimidate, persuade, dominate, and  at least one other option.
I don't really have any other game that plays a bit like fallout3/oblivion and lets me be a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ vampire. The mechanics are a bit clumsy but nothing too terrible once you rebind some keys.  There are some bugs you may encounter but so far on my recent play I have yet to run into anything major on the steam version with the community patch installed.

reviewText:
This is one of those underated games. Even if you don't like fantasy stuff or vampires, this is one game you're going to love especially if you're into First Person Shooters with RPG featutes. Anyone who is into games like Fallout or Skyrim will like this unknown gem.

You play as a vampire who was recently turned and a result must learn the ways of the vampire. This isn't your regular vampire game. You must blend in as a human and learn skills that benefit you throughout the game. You gotta learn to hack computers and break into locks along with supernatural abilities like blowing up people by boiling up their blood.

Not only is the gameplay fun as hell, but the storyline is actually pretty interesting. Learn about different sects of vampires and choose who to side with. Be wise, as some choices are harder to keep than others.

reviewText:
Despite its quirks (graphical hiccups, repeated NPCs, wonky combat) and the absolute NEED to mod V:tM-B in order to run it on modern systems, Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines is, hands-down, one of the best RPGs - and possibly the best vampire game - ever made. Simply put, LA does not give two hoots about you, and events are only driven forward when you begin to interfere. Nevermind that vampires have generally fallen out of favor amongst gamers - this is one that should be played through at least once. Lust, hunger, betrayal, and hard decisions - its all here.

Expect to die at least a couple of times; the game doesn't pull its punches, and will backhand anyone thinking they're running on rails. The game's world may seem small, but given that the game is over 10 years old now it has quite a bit of space to roam. Maybe not Witcher levels of freedom, but very few of the game's quests are (or really feel like) fetch quests. The things you do change how the game plays, and each Family has their own oddities to them - both good and bad.

If there ever was a game that needed a graphical (and gameplay) overhaul, though, it would be this one. The visuals, while striking, are severly dated, and you'll see the same bums/hookers/random people begin to repeat over and over after a while (although it does give the feeling that the city is beginning to mess with your head). As well, the combat system feels severely tacked-on, and while functional, it is almost ALWAYS preferable to go in with a gun rather than a bat or blade, as melee combat suffers the worst. While it only becomes troublesome in a few areas, those can be the places that make one throw the keyboard in disgust.

Finally, as mentioned, the game will NOT run unpatched, so picking up an unofficial patch is necessary to run it on a system with a Windows 7 or newer OS (not sure about Vista; it might work, but it definitely doesn't on W7). Attempting to run the game unpatched causes many issues, so don't even think about it.

Overall, though, it is worth picking up (especially when it goes on-sale), as it was Troika's last game before they went bankrupt, and while buggy their games have managed to pick up cult classic status over the years. Beyond that, its a damn good convoluted tale featuring the children of the night, and certainly deserves praise for making the player FEEL like they're a bloodsucking monster.

reviewText:
Where's the Fun Without Complications?
Despite the apparent negative review this game is a must play. A classic.

PROS:
Good memories right here with this game!
Great atmosphere, very mysterious.
Dark as no other vampire game.
Graphics.
Sound\Music\Voice acting.
Disciplines are amazing.
Malkavians offer a whole new game.

CONS:
Ten years past you can really notice the old engine and bugs.
This game is just not up to nowadays standard in gaming.
Feels unfinished.
The final game was a lot different from a very famous trailer.
Combat feels wrong, poorly done.
There are no kids, cats, dogs, birds.
Character models look kinda the same.

MISC:
Be sure to install the Unofficial Patch (plus is optional) by Wesp5, it is a must!

My score: 8/10

reviewText:
Positive:
* Great atmosphere via detailed environments, soundtrack and characters.
* Plenty of fun quests and like all great RPGs, no busywork padding. The focus is on characters and the storyline.
* Characters can be built around several different playstyles, including sneaking, charisma, melee/ranged combat, etc. The quests incorporate these different choices nicely
* Great voice acting for the most part
Negative:
* No cosmetic character customization like hairstyles or facial features, you only chose gender and clan.
* The game is a buggy mess out of the box, luckily there's an actively maintained unofficial patch.
* Combat is a bit clunky, nevertheless fun though.
voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText:
If you haven't already, playing as a Malkavian is a must at least once. Though maybe not the first playthrough :P

-You speak pretty much entirely in riddles and it's interesting that some of those subtly foreshadow what's going to happen. Lotta great dialogue options for Malks
-Creepy ♥♥♥ whispers in the background. Scares the crap out of me on a regular basis
-The TV newscaster breaks the in-game fourth wall and addresses your character directly quite a few times. Scared the crap out of me the first time
-Beatles references when you speak with one of the NPCs, Skelter.
-You can argue with a ♥♥♥♥ing stop sign


Also, one of the endings (for all clans, not just the Malks)you can literally tell everyone to ♥♥♥♥ off because they've all been using you. I can't even say how much I loved this because it's like seriously. I'm not your errand dog.

Be warned though, it's 12 years old and super buggy. Bless the lovely, wonderful community for the mods and patches or otherwise this game would probably be unplayable as Troika went out of business about a year after this came out. Actually, I believe there's even a patch you need to have to play at all.

It has its issues but, damn, I love this game.

9/10

First/third person perspective of the early unlife of a Vampire in the World of White Wolf (mostly).
Despite the need for a patch (yes, you want to do that), and the game being so old, the game is still an amazing simulator for making your way as a Neonate (newborn) Vamp.

reviewText:
This quickly became my favorite RPG (TLDR version at the bottom)

The second I started up the game, it crashed with an error that made no sense

a quick patch later I was introduced to a world great atmosphere, great story, great characters (Every person is unique, well acted, well written, and not a single voice actor is recycled), great music and terrible combat.

seriously, the combat in this game is  awful . I hated every combat section because it was uncomfortable, clunky, with insane difficulty spikes. This game is also really glitchy. But they never broke my game and only broke immersion twice. The Physics (Source game, of course) were all over the place. Very unnecesary. Hair and clothes bounce without restraint and makes walking around in third person look really silly.


TL:DR version
PROS:
+Atmosphere
+Story
+Lore
+Characters(All uniwue and well written
+Voice Acting (no voice actors are recycled)
+Graphics (aged a bit, but still holds up)
+Music

CONS:
-Combat
-very glitchy

10/10 I cry every night I remember there's no sequel

reviewText:
I'd like to preface by saying this is the review of the game with the latest unofficial patch by wesp. My applause to wesp.

I'm about to be honest and give this great game a hard review. No doubt that this game is quite unique in what it offers, a traditional RPG experience in a dark themed vampire world. The best part of it hands down is the story and the immersive atmosphere of the game. The story and the text is so deep and extensive that you lose yourself just talking to so many characters and getting insight into their stories and background information of the latest happenings.

I have a few issues with it so here comes the tough love;

1. It is unplayable without the patch

2. Even with the patch it has its share of buggy moments

3. Combat :(

Oh dear. This is what stopped this game from being the my top 5 RPG games of all time; RPG being my favourite genre of games. It really kills the immersion and knocks down a potentially near perfect game (for its time). The combat is just so wonky and I wouldn't take issue with this if the game was a lot more focused on interaction in the world, solving mysteries and story driven. However a decent chunk of the mission design is combat based and its painfully bad to the point where I just took every shortcut and option possible to avoid it, including console commands later in the game because I hated the combat so much. I could go into more detail, but I'll leave it at that.

4. Furthermore the game is a little clunky in places as you go through it and I've had a few times where the game just freezes.

5. I also had to do additional tweaking of the game just to prevent motion sickness by adjusting FOV, resolution and playing 3rd person often when I felt a little sick (despite FOV fix)

6. There are sound issues that have to be also seperately addressed in settings to prevent echoing

Story 10/10

Graphics (doesn't mater)

Gameplay (8.5/10)

Controls (♥♥♥♥ed)

If you have the time and energy to give modify this game with the official patch and tweak it to get it running properly you will 100% enjoy this game if you're an RPG fan, however those who are new to PC gaming or steam I'd avoid it because of the modifications neccessary for optimal experience.

I'd only recommend this game with the patch and tweaks!

Final Verdict: 8/10 Overall. Solid experience with an excellent story, brought down unfortunately by the controls and combat. Takes a spot in my top 10 RPG games.

reviewText: One of my all time favourite RPGs. As apposed to most role–playing games, Bloodlines offers a more diverse approach to the platform, creating near unique scenarios for each different Clan, outfitted with bespoke abilities and skills. One of the more enjoyable qualities of Bloodlines is that – and unlike most other games of the same genre – content transcends the battle front, development and progression is key to successs. Having said that, combat is equally as awesome as storyline content, and one of the funnest aspect of the game for me so far has been trying out different Clans, and seeing how they work differently with dialogue and the eventual endgame, there's to say it's a very redoable game as long as you broaden your horizons for each new character and select a different Clan for your playthrough.\n\n100% recommendable for RPG fans.
voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText: Everytime I buy a game I want two things. A well made story, and fun gameplay that makes me have to think. This game delivered on both fronts fantastically. I would even go so far as to say that this is my second favorite game of all time (the first being DA:O) The game not only has branching dialog options, but multiple factions and endings. It also has a level up system similar to shadowrun, with you being able to improve both combat and non combat skills. This makes balancing your character hard, because while you may be able to talk your way out of some fights, not all of them will be easy or even possible. The game made for a fun experience where I felt like a bloodsucker stalking the streets of hollywood, caught up in a battle with multiple choices and vital decisions that could change the world. Overall, the great story wrapped me up in a web and I thought about the moral and fatal conse qunces of every action, from decisions that could shake the world, to where to spend my experience so that i could spend another night breathing, VTMB had me thinking about every action, and their consequences. 10/10\n\nP.S. Install the unofficial patch, you won't regrett it.

reviewText:
A truly unique game. Even if you're not a huge fan of the vampire/werewolf mythos like me, you'll still have quite a bit of fun in this game because it immerses you into its world so effectively. Troika deserves full marks for this one, even though the game has its issues and the numerous glitches that the community has worked greatly to improve. Those same efforts only highlight how much this game is almost universally loved by those that try it. Great game, definitely recommend trying it, if you're on the fence that badly wait for a price drop but please do yourself a favor and play it at the very least.

Do not play without the community-made patches, however, as the game was rushed and contains glitches galore without said patches.

Here's to hoping White Wolf or someone else embraces" this franchise and brings it back from the dead."

reviewText:
With the Unofficial Patch, this game is absolutely amazing!
It's everything you'd want in an RPG: great characters, unique locations, alternate endings which stem from a terrific storyline.
All in all, VTMB's take on the folklore of vampires is the selling point for me personally, perfectly encapsulating the western perception of vampires. However, VTMB doesn't limit you to the usual sneak, seduce and feed vampiric stereotype, it allows you to choose between several races of vampire, each with unique abilities called Disciplines which fill a whole range of playstyles and simultaneously increase replayability.
I'd definitely recommend it, and I wish I had stumbled upon this game sooner.
voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText:
Reading through the negative reviews here, most of them have the same complaint: they can’t get the game running. It’s true the game won’t run on a modern OS without the unofficial patch, which is shameful on Activision’s part, especially since the creator of the patch offered it to them for free.

But despite the annoyance of getting the game running, it has a 94% approval rating here on Steam. Indeed it seems nearly everyone that actually managed to play the game liked it. That speak volumes of the game.

Apart from getting the game running is it flawless? Not entirely, the gameplay leaves a lot to be desired. While the combat isn’t as clunky as the first Deus Ex, enemies with fully automatic weapons will kill you in about two seconds, though these enemies mostly appear towards the end of the game and thankfully stealth is preposterously easy.

So why play this game? Simple: Atmosphere and Characters. This game has such wonderful way of making you feel like a creature of the night. The graphics are obviously dated, but there are nice touches such as animated facial expressions. The original soundtrack is great, although the cheap licensed rock music playing in the various nightclubs is terrible.

What really keeps me coming back to this game is the characters. Though most of them are clinically dead they are more alive the character in any other game I’ve played. The dialogue is brilliantly written and voice acted. It’s just a delight to talk to people in this game. The Vampire Politics at the heart of the game are also really fascinating and how you treat the different factions affects which endings are available to you.

Despite the problems with getting it running and the rather poor gameplay this is a must play if you like good writing in games. If, however, you only care about gameplay this game is not for you.

reviewText: Bloodlines did a great job of capturing the dark, off-putting atmosphere inherent to the World of Darkness. It goes from humorous, but unstable characters to supernaturally unnerving very well and is a generally enjoyable experience. Unsurprising since its based off a pen-and-paper RPG, but the roleplaying experience is very fulfilling and your characters will develop as you see fit.\n\nHowever, there are a couple noticeable problems with the game. The melee combat is a little wonky and a little difficult to control to the degree one desires. There are a couple of filler" points in the game where a level extends further than necessary for atmosphere and story-telling purposes. And without patches
date: the game is unstable.\n\nBut despite these flaws
recommended: the game is definitely worth picking up and playing if you like the World of Darkness

reviewText: The game is brooding, dark, and seductive, just like a vampire :D.  If you like the World of Darkness, or very dark and bloody vampires, this is the game for you. It has amazing music, wonderful atmosphere, and genuine heart. You can play the game very different ways, including flinging potent spells, stealthing, using insanity or seduction as a form of attack, or stalking the streets as a feral beast.\n\nIt also has a number of flaws, including a weak combat system and rushed level design in the later parts of the game. Still, the flaws in the game are worth overcoming to enjoy the amazing atmosphere.

reviewText:
This is one of the best games I've ever played, and I've played it a year ago for the first time so you can believe me when I say it's not nostalgia talking. I am a huge vampire fan and for my entire life I've waited for a game like this, not knowing it was right under my nose the entire time. It is totally worth the full price, and it gets %75 on every sale so there's literally no reason not to buy this.

Pros:
A great story, accompanied by characters you'll love or love to hate
Pretty dark  world that feels gothic, even though it's just Santa Monica at night
Aged well, graphics would not bother you at all if you're not obsessd with next gen stuff etc
Gameplay is pretty nice and gives you lots of different options about how to play. You can even finish lots of quests with speechcraft. Adds replayability to the game
It is pretty realistic, you can't go around butchering people like there's no tomorrow since you'll lose humanity and succumb into the beast, if you try to play like not drinking any blood you'll die. You can even role play and drink the blood of animals/blood packs.

Cons:
With some builds you can't go too far in the game. Like if you only skilled bloodmagic as your combat choice you can't get passed the sewer episode since creatures there won't give you any blood.
Even though the story was great, the ending kinda felt rushed.
Game needs to be patched manually before it can be played(not exactly a con, just wanted to point it out)


So long story short, BUY THE ♥♥♥♥ING GAME YOU WON'T REGRET IT

reviewText: The game is brooding, dark, and seductive, just like a vampire :D.  If you like the World of Darkness, or very dark and bloody vampires, this is the game for you. It has amazing music, wonderful atmosphere, and genuine heart. You can play the game very different ways, including flinging potent spells, stealthing, using insanity or seduction as a form of attack, or stalking the streets as a feral beast.\n\nIt also has a number of flaws, including a weak combat system and rushed level design in the later parts of the game. reviewText:
Let's get this out of the way. I admire ambition more than production quality or polish. That having been said explains why I like this game so much. Now, this game has a well-earned reputation for being buggy as all Troika games were and is riddled with unfinished content. It also is most likely not going to play properly without modding, so if any of those three things I just mentioned irritate you, then avoid this like the plague.

I like that it's rather ambigious and subtle with its story telling. I like the pacing and I like the atmosphere of most of the game. The power pools are fairly fun and memorable, the side quests are interesting and I like all of the endings, too.

The engine has not aged well since it was based off a very early release of the Source engine though that is fixable with fan patches. I still find this to be a flawed gem, but your mileage may vary.

reviewText: Don't let its appearance deceive you; underneath an early Source Engine exterior lies a truly magnificent game that takes the World of Darkness Role-Playing system and brings it to the  moderately-sized screen. Taking the role of a newly-turned vampire, the player navigates the strange new world of the supernatural as the Vampire Society faces a threat that could change the world as we know it. Choose supernatural powers such as transmogrification and invisibility and master skills such as lockpicking, firearms and hacking and face off with a host of foes that would do anything to see you die your last death. You're about to find out that the World of Darkness isn't much better than our own...

Seven distinctive classes (read: bloodlines, get it?) and a complex network of attributes, talents and disciplines send players through unique story archs, creating genuinely exciting replay potential. The GTA-style open world is packed with fun, story-driven quests that span a broad spectrum of level designs, some of which are among my favorite to date (many are truly terrifying), all of them teeming with World of Darkness's inspired takes on classic horror creatures. reviewText: Absloute genuis. This game is absolute genuis. The story is VERY well writen, the graphics hold up incredibly well considering when this game was made (however mods are recomended), the characters feel real, and the combat is very satisfying. That being said make sure you download the unofficial patch because this game is broken without it. You only gain experience by completing quests and there are ALOT of them. The side quests can distract you from the story for awhile but they aren't needed to complete the game but its recomended that you do them in order to level-up your stats. At the begining of the game you really only need melee skill, but once you get farther in you really need some ranged skill or your gonna have a hard time. You can pick from 7 diferent vampire clans each one VERY different from the others, even more so if you pick a background for your character, but thats not required. There are some pretty dark moments, but its a game about modern day vampires so there kinda has to be. I HIGHLY recommend this game to any RPG fan, you will not regret buying this game. This game is very underrated and deserves much more attention and recognition.

reviewText:
+Good Story
+Good Voice Acting
+Good Atmosphere
+Great RPG Elements (Race, Skills, Items)
+Varied Gameplay (stealth, lockpicking, hacking, combat, conversation)
+Good Conversation Choice system

-Weak Combat
-Uneven Pacing

I have a love / hate relationship game.  From my perspective, you have a game that is very much like the original Deus Ex in terms of choice by in-game actions or conversations mixed with a compelling atmosphere perfect for the location and time period of the story.  Being able to make various choices or alternate routes of completing goals is awesome.  The 90s pop / gothic vampire cults imbued in Southern California culture is convincing and enjoyable.

Unfortunately, there are some design decisions that prevent it from being the same great addicting experience that is Deus Ex.  The combat is lousy.  While Deus Ex has aged in terms of gunplay, there are at least mechanics to perform instanteous lethal kills or knockouts.  While stealth holds up with human foes, it is somewhat hindered in my point of view by the third person perspective that is forced when equipped with a melee weapon.  When firing at an aware NPC, the combat feels similar to a bullet sponge FPS with no ADS.  Think Halo.  This would not be a problem if you did not get forced into critical situations requiring combat, however, there are boss fights that must be completed throughout the main quest.

Combat aside, the game has trouble with pacing.  Some times you can become stuck trying to find an item or clue that will set you off on the next thread of the main quest.  While tinkering around the world is enjoyable, being lost in 90s computer records is not great.

Anyways, I think this game should definitely be played.  Buy it when on sale and dedicate 6 hours of game time before calling quits.  Also, spending time with a character creation guide to make the most of your skills and vampire powers is advised.

[GET AT SALE]

Now, you'll probably say '' vampires are gay and it's gay to watch/play them ''. Well I've never seen a vampire that was gay and I actually love girls and only girls.
Vampires are awesome, supernatural stuff always been awesome and the vampires are In my opinion, the greatest, now of course Twilight is another story, Twilight is giving a bad name to the vampires but do not trust Twilight, it's stupid.

Vampire: The Masquerade, Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines, Buffy the Vampire Slayer, Castlevania, Legacy of Kain, BloodRayne, Blood Omen, Darkstalkers, Soul Reaver, Nosferatu, Dracula: Undead Awakening and The Elder Scrolls just to name some, there are some others that are really great, that's about it for the video games.

reviewText:
....But seriously, play this game is all I'll say as the bottom line.
Vampire the Masquerade: Bloodlines has one of the best voice acting I've heard in video games from the sheer amount of life breathed into each character. This game has something for everybody and may try way too hard in some places but makes up for it with variety, fun, and creative level designs that become familiar rather quickly. After installing the unofficial patch to fix this game, it becomes one of the best games you'll play from the 2000's. Take it as an RPG/Dialogue sim or make it a FPS, there's no wrong way to play this game and it'll give you enough option to try as many routes as you want without much repetition outside of the main storyline. Buy it, play it, then play it again in a completely different way and as a completely different class - this game will let very few players down.

Pros:
+High replayability including multiple endings and a GOOD variety of classes/clans.
+Excellent Voice Acting
+Decent Combat System
+Great Environments
+Memorable Characters
+Great Writing and an interesting plot
+Informative menus and inventories with a quest log

Cons:
-Bugged as hell (fixed with the unofficial patches)
-Music is pretentious and laughable and sounds like somebody compressed three entire Hot Topics into a soundtrack
-Backtracking becomes tedious

reviewText:
I tried to play this game years ago and abandoned it after a short time due to the amount of bugs rendering it unplayable. After rediscovering the game a far corner of my steam library, I decided to give it another go.

Io and behold! By now, a very active community of enthusiasts has fixed 99% of these problems with their unofficial patches. And the game is an absolute gem. Brilliant writing, memorable characters, dialogues and settings. I Recommend it wholeheartedly. Where else can you play a batshit crazy vampire who ventures to have a conversation with a stop sign?

While the story is quite linear, it provides reason to replay it because the different clans of vampires provide very unique game experiences: Some, like Toreador and Ventrue, will be able to talk themselves out of most situations. The Nosferatu look like the monsters they are and will cause a panic the moment a mortal sees them, which leads to a focus on sneaking and exploring the sewers of the city. The Brujah are combat experts, inviting a hack'n'slash melee-fest. Others, like the Tremere, focus on magic.
And then there's the Malkavians, a strand of vampires who's very blood causes insanity, leading to some of the craziest dialogues in video game history. They can (temporarily?) cause insanity in others - who wouldn't want to make their annoying ex think you're their long lost pet turtle? It also allows them a near prophetic insight into their conversation partners' thoughts and motives - That is, if you listen to the right voices n your head and ignore the others...

reviewText:
Before I start with my review on Vampire: The Masquerade know that it is an old game. As such the graphics are not up to par with current standards. Moreover, the base game is riddled with quirky to game breaking bugs. However, there is a dedicated patch by fans that solves all these issues and brings new (restored from the orginal concept) powers and game balances to the game. My review will be about the game with this unofficial patch for that is the way to experience this game.

VTM is a RPG about vampire in the setting of the likewise named pen & paper version. The main abilities of your vampire depend on the clan you choose. Although all of them share the greater part of skills, you have unique abilities linked to your clan that are at times shared by another but never in the same combination. Furthermore your background alters your starting proficiencies, and your sex does matter in the game at some small points.

The game seems to be made out of two parts. The beginning is a true RPG, with heavy quests and side-quests, intrigue, and the ability to stealth, talk or fight through these quests (not all of these opportunities for each quest, but most of the time at least 2). After a certain point though, the game starts more to become a Hack & Slash RPG - probably to allow you to use all those cool vampire powers you have been putting points into, but it does break the experience a bit here. Regardless of that the RPG does have some adult stuff, even if it black screens at moment supremes, it at least does not shy from it. The feel of the world is dark indeed and it feels trully unlike other RPGs.

Replaybility is supposedly low as with other story driven RPGs, but I would advice using some clans for a second or third run (I did them all) for some of them are quite the game changer - like the Nosferatu or Malkavian vs. the other clans - moreso than just another class in e.g. Baldur's Gate. Now I did all the clans for runs and you can see from my profile I do not have a huge amount of hours in game, thus it is not very long - but the price is also not high.

In my opinion this game is definately worth the pricetag for a relative short RPG in a very unique environment.

reviewText:
Vampire and RPG, what could you ask more? The graphics may be dated but this game is seriously awesome, if you got textures problems then deactivate/activate '' bump mapping '' in the options In game, it works great for me.
If your game won't launch/crash then launch the game in administrator mode and Windows XP (Service Pack 2) it works for me, you can also download the custom patches but I'm not using them and the game is working pretty fine.

Now, you'll probably say '' vampires are gay and it's gay to watch/play them ''. Well I've never seen a vampire that was gay and I actually love girls and only girls.
Vampires are awesome, supernatural stuff always been awesome and the vampires are In my opinion, the greatest, now of course Twilight is another story, Twilight is giving a bad name to the vampires but do not trust Twilight, it's stupid.

Vampire: The Masquerade, Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines, Buffy the Vampire Slayer, Castlevania, Legacy of Kain, BloodRayne, Blood Omen, Darkstalkers, Soul Reaver, Nosferatu, Dracula: Undead Awakening and The Elder Scrolls just to name some, there are some others that are really great, that's about it for the video games.

The Vampire Diaries, True Blood, The Originals, Buffy the Vampire Slayer are some great vampire TV series. The Vampire Diaries and The Originals are my favorites, you'll love them if you love history and supernatural even if they're not really horror, drama and suspense, True Blood is really great too.

Let Me In, Near Dark, Blade are some great vampire movies.

Hellsing, Vampire Knight, Blood + are some great vampire animes.

There are also books like The Vampire Diaries (the original serie and the new one) and probably many more but I am not much of a reader.


If you've watched, played, read all of them and didn't like any of them then you're just not to Vampire/Supernatural stuff.

Look at the vampire lord in The Elder Scrolls: Skyrim, It is amazing, not like Twilight.
Vampires can be pretty badass actually, just stop looking at Twilight.
I seriously wish that there would be another Vampire The Masquerade but It probably won't happen.

Anyway great game, I recommend 9.5/10 and don't forget, Twilight is simply stupid, vampires aren't about beauty, In the Vampire Diaries they manage to make it awesome but normally vampires are supposed to be scary so do not believe Twilight.
No hate, just facts, If you like Twilight then it's good for you, I don't really care but it's not a true vampire movie, it's just some random movie for 8 years old and mainstream girls.

9.5/10

reviewText:
....But seriously, play this game is all I'll say as the bottom line.
Vampire the Masquerade: Bloodlines has one of the best voice acting I've heard in video games from the sheer amount of life breathed into each character. This game has something for everybody and may try way too hard in some places but makes up for it with variety, fun, and creative level designs that become familiar rather quickly. After installing the unofficial patch to fix this game, it becomes one of the best games you'll play from the 2000's. Take it as an RPG/Dialogue sim or make it a FPS, there's no wrong way to play this game and it'll give you enough option to try as many routes as you want without much repetition outside of the main storyline. Buy it, play it, then play it again in a completely different way and as a completely different class - this game will let very few players down.

Pros:
+High replayability including multiple endings and a GOOD variety of classes/clans.
+Excellent Voice Acting
+Decent Combat System
+Great Environments
+Memorable Characters
+Great Writing and an interesting plot
+Informative menus and inventories with a quest log

Cons:
-Bugged as hell (fixed with the unofficial patches)
-Music is pretentious and laughable and sounds like somebody compressed three entire Hot Topics into a soundtrack
-Backtracking becomes tedious

reviewText:
One of the best Action-RPG's I've ever seen.  Doesn't age at all.
Awesome soundtrack, great plot, including side-quests, non-linear gameplay, a variety of classes and skills.


Each clan has its own style, they are typically divided into classic groups: warrior, mage, marksman, thief, the-one-who-talks etc. I recommend to play with Malkavian or Nosferatu on your SECOND try, as the difficulty with these clans is higher due to their appearance and manner of speech. Totally different game.


Bugs and dated graphics are the only things that can bother: sometimes scripts don't work, sometimes the game crashes, you can encounter some glitches, but let's face the truth: Fallout 3 & 4 have the same problems, but you still play 'em.
That's why it is important to save all the time and two have at least 2-3 active saves.

reviewText:
Great game overall but it was rushed out the door because of money issues but the game is still a masterpiece even as is. There are unofficial mods that will make the game play better and also change it as well. Play it through once with the official patches and then MOD it. Be sure to investigate the world and do the side quests to open up more side quests. Have fun. It is made with the Source 2 engine I believe.

Forget about all the negatives people have said about this game. It is well worth 5, 10 or 20 dollars even with it's age. The only reason this game was released before it was polished up is BIG F'ing GAME COMPANIES who want dev teams to rush out their content. When this game was bought out that company could have spend a few thousand dollars finishing it up and made multi-millions off it but short sighted money hungry attitudes killed that idea. The game as is is a Vampire Masterpiece and I am not a fanatic of vampire stuff.

Even if you don't like RPGs this game is still appealing. Yes the graphics are not as they should be, nor is the controls on PC but the overall atmosphere, storyline, quests, items you can use, characters, dialog, areas to travel, humor, horror, music, etc. are very original and immersive and enjoyable.

About patches: There is no real company to work on this game anymore so there are no fixes from those who created the game. But there are many mods out there that do fix a lot of broken things in the game and even some mods that overhaul the game extensively. There are model and skin patches as well. Nude and otherwise. The mods are NOT hard to install. If you can read it is very simple. The only thing that I had an issue with is the game not running on install from Steam and in 64bit mode. There is a patch to fix this. Sorry I do not have the links at the moment. Google them or look on the community page.

I have the boxed version and the Steam version and have played it lots of times in many ways. All have been pleasurable experiences. I recommend playing through without modding it first if you can or at least not using the overhaul mods that change too much of the game. Then play again with the conversion MODS.

The game gets a 10/10 for me even with the quirks and work I have to do to get it to work efficiently.

reviewText: This is probably one of the games that has the most bugs, the most glitches, and the most crashes I've played in the past ten years. It is also one of the best games I have ever played. The theme and mood are perfectly put together. Most of the quests are both exciting and interesting, without any filler whatsoever. It is incredibly fun to experience the growth and development of your vampire. The only aspect that will bore you and aggravate you will be the bugs, glitches, crashes, and sometimes sub par AI. Even the voice acting is well done. Easily, one of my current top five favorite games of all time on the PC. Even with all the glitches, bugs, and crashes. Do not miss out on this one!\n\nVampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines is great.

reviewText:
This review is written from an account of a player who uses the most recent Unofficial Patch by Wesp5, the Plus rendition. As I see it, the plethora of bugfixes and restored content make the game much more enjoyable than the latest official release. The patch, downloadable from the Patches Scrolls (google that :P ) is a must-have in my opinion.

As we're dealing with a game from... 2004, if memory serves... the graphics aren't top notch anymore and they never were, but they're realistic enough not to be a pain for the eyes. The Source Engine definitely helps with the realistic facial expressions and there's a lot of those. The music is a quite moody ambient-sounding set of tracks, however this changes when you enter the nightclubs - all the tracks used in those seem similar to one another, so similar they quickly bore. The sound effects - they are just there. Neither especially good or bad, just... there.

What the game shines in is the story. While fairly linear, it can be experienced in several different ways due to the number of different vampire clans available. The NPCs will react differently to a Ventrue than they do to a Malkavian, for obvious reasons - both clans have different personality traits. Ventrue are cunning in political nuances whereas Malkavian are insane, each of them. There are five different endings available too, so there's a lot of replay value.

Aside from the story, the game is a hybrid of RPG and FPS. The RPG aspects are focused on increasing your skills and traits in order to fare better in problem solutions of your choice, however you won't be able to avoid killing others in order to have your way and that's what the FPS aspect is for: guns, blades, combat disciplines - all this has but one goal. To kill. And depending on which side you pick, you'll get to kill some of the other side. The World of Darkness is a brutal place.

I could mention a whole lot of flaws - but the continuous support for the game - even if unofficial - and the amount of hours I spent on playing it even before I got it on Steam, all this speaks for itself. A 10/10 from me and a badass seal of approval.

reviewText:
Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines was rushed and pushed out the door by Activision. As a result, the game is rather buggy, featuring shoddy AI, missing content, broken stealth mechanics, and other annoyances.

In spite of that, this is perhaps one of my favorite games I've ever played. This is an absolutely charming and underrated game.
It's a closed sandbox RPG: think Deus Ex (a masterpiece) but set in the modern world... and with vampires and other creatures of the night.

There are seven different vampire clans you can choose to be part of. Can't decide which one? Then take the quiz the game offers, I got the Tremere: the spellcasting mages that use blood as their mana. Allowing you to steal an opponent's blood from a distance or internally boil" their blood until they explode into a visceral masterpiece. It's rather adorable
date: honestly.\nThe gameplay is similar to Deus Ex
recommended: an RPG first person action game with multiple choices affecting the story
hoursPlayed: thus each playthrough is different from the other.\n\nThere are multiple weapons to use: firearms

helpfulPercent: and your own clan skills are all fun to use. There is also a skill tree allowing you to customize and enchance your proficiency in certain categories
votesHelpful: although many of the skills are rather useless save for a few circumstances.\n\nThe graphics aren't too shabby to be honest. This is the first game to use the Source engine (even before Half Life 2) and while dated by today's standards
votesTotal: is still a fairly nice game to look at. The facial animations in particular look great.\nThe atmosphere though is simply wonderful: the characters all feel real

Add on top of that the community created patch(es) and replay-ability options, and you have a great game that could have been so much more if they ironed out the glitches.

reviewText: With new unofficial patch 8.9 installed, this game's graphic and game play is significantly improved. The game feels more whole and more up to date. The chracters are more interesting. Also all the computer password are online, don't bother upgrading computer hacking skills, it's a waste. I did the questionire at the beginning and got Malkavian. Also I like Malkavian because they can force insanity on other people and make them go crazy as well.

reviewText:
VTMB is a hidden gem in the RPG genre. Not a lot of people know about it, partially because it has some flaws which are off putting to some.

It runs on an early version of the Source engine, which is just so sucky and glitchy.

Another flaw is combat. It can be a bit boring and way to difficult, especially melee because it is clunky and awkward. There is supposed to be a system of pushing directional keys to vary your swings, but it doesn't work well. I high recommend playing a gun-wielding character.

However, in the long run, combat is mostly avoidable (more on that later), so it doesn't matter too much.

Other than that, this game is perfect. You get to play as a vampire for one thing, which is awsome. I know of no RPG like this except Oblivion, but those aren't real vampires in that game. The world's lore about secret vampire societies and laws is really well thought out and interesting. The sheer amount of it shows you how much work the developers put into the game.

Another great feature is the story. I just felt that it was really cool and interesting. It's very subtle and mature without being too long-winded. The dialouge is really awesome as well. In fact, both the voice acting AND the writting of the characters made me feel like I was watching a movie or reading a novel.

The gameplay and rules system is also extremely well done. You're assigned experience for completeing goals. Thats it. No XP from killing things. A lot of RPG's award too much XP for killing, and as a result you're actually punished for finding alternate soloutions because you'll be under leveled. In VTMB, there are always multiple ways to finish a quest. You could be a cowboy and fight your way through it, or you could look around for a way to sneak in. Or maybe you can hack a computer? Don't forget charming, persuading, or intimidating people to get your way. You're allowed to play any way you want and have tons of freedom. More RPG's need to be this way.

All things considered, VTMB is an awesome game that compensates for it's flaws with a legendary story and backdrop. It's a must have for RPG fans who like vampires.
